question: Question 101. According to the sign posted in front of the main office, the repair center is now  …………new management.
Question 102. ………….you are no doubt aware, the new security system requires the installation of a backup power source in case an emergency situation arises.
Question 103. After a highly profitable first six months, the restaurant's profits for the second half of the year were a great…………..
Question 104. Naturally, our company utilizes the production process ……….. guarantees the most satisfactory results.
Question 105. The unexpected surge in the prices of steel and other minerals will result in a dramatic increase in tax ………….. this year.
Question 106. Company strategists ……………. predicted that conditions in the Middle East would eventually stabilize and result in expanded sales.
Question 107. The director …………….. has often been seen to take his lunch in the staff canteen along with the other workers.
Question 108. The secretary filling in at the reception desk has been performing so well that management is considering offering her a ………….. position.
Question 109. Ms. Harris was extremely ……………… to take an opportunity to thank you for all of the hard-working and dedication.
Question 110. ………………. in computer technology have allowed technicians to perform multi-dimensional graphics far better than ever before.
Question 111. To gain access to confidential company documents, employees require ………………. from the operations manager.
Question 112. The Department of the Environment supports the replacement of introduced plants with ……………. plants that require much less watering.
Question 113. Ms. Julie Kennedy and her innovative marketing team have gained renown for creating …………………. products for struggling companies.
Question 114. The Department of Social Welfare's report this year indicated that it is focusing ………….on the homeless and long-term unemployed.
Question 115. ABC Shoe Store asked …………….. to make their final selections and bring them to cashiers' stations within 30 minutes.
Question 116. In next month's issue, …………..coupons offering a steep discount for new subscriptions only.
Question 117. Under ……………. circumstances, the CEO would have approved the pay increases, but this year it was not possible.
Question 118. Consultation with the appropriate experts is essential if we are to arrive at an ………….. decision.
Question 119. As of October 1, Carla Fishermen will …………….. the company as its interface in all dealings with the local government.
Question 120. Although he did not perform ………………. well as a student, he went on to become one of the most respected scholars in his field.
Question 121. After the earthquake, the building was ……………. unsafe since its foundation was badly damaged.
Question 122. The upcoming convention invites …………….. from anyone working or having research interests in the field.
Question 123. Health inspections are conducted …………….. at restaurants throughout the province for the purpose of maintaining high standards of hygiene.
Question 124. Several exciting new pieces of equipment ………………………. in our gymnasium, and we invite you to come and try them out at no cost during the next week.
Question 125. All drivers are required to maintain ……….. logbooks accurately and to hand them in to the central office before leaving on Friday night.
Question 126. As you would expect at one of the world's most reputable hotels, the ……………. is prompt, efficient, and discreet.
Question 127. Rexington Engineering has recently set up an entire new research …………… because of the increasing interest in robotic technology.
Question 128. A small group of contestants has been selected following a nationwide search …………….. over the last six months.
Question 129. The chief financial officer believes that we should maintain the present course, …………. his deputy.
Question 130. One of the leading companies, Big Star agreed to buy ………… drug company for 10 billion dollars.
Question 131. Because there were too many participants at the seminar, we should ………… them into smaller groups for discussion.
Question 132. ……………. wanting to apply for maternity leave should let their immediate supervisor know about their plans at least one month in advance.
Question 133. Electron Recycling has developed a profitable business by recycling metals retrieved from ……………. electronic components.
Question 134. The new head of marketing is already making his mark on the company even though he only arrived 6 weeks ago.
Question 135. The FM convenience store in the central park is ………….. situated and it is always busy with many customers.
Question 136. Once you have paid the appropriate student fees, you will be able to …………. the medical, recreational, and other facilities.
Question 137. Although the ……………… for the best design will be very fierce, Mr. Gozalas has a good chance of getting the award.
Question 138. While we still take telephone calls, other …………….. of correspondence are encouraged to avoid tying up telephone lines unnecessarily.
Question 139. Numerous speakers came forward to express their gratitude ………. the retiring secretary's unfailing courtesy and efficiency.
Question 140. ……………. more. factory workers are hired, we cannot meet the deadline for the products on time.
Question 141. ……………… the recent sales campaign was not as successful as we had expected, our new range of goods has been well reviewed by consumer groups.
Question 142. The giant pharmaceutical company insists that its new drug is …………….. as long as it is used under the supervision of a doctor.
Question 143. ……………. you have familiarized yourself with the basic commands, we can begin to learn some of this program's more creative features.
Question 144. It is true that the number of traffic accidents involving cyclists has increased ……………… over the last 10 years.
Question 145. Students can ……………… in the university’s education program starting July 6th.
Question 146. Hyssop Chemists is ………….. experienced pharmacists for the eight new locations they have opened this year.
Question 147. This is an excellent time to consider changing jobs because of the large number of positions------ available in the mining sector.
Question 148. The waitress said there weren't any tables open, but she would call my name once one became ..............
Question 149. A light and healthy lunch followed by some exercise will make workers ------- more productive in the afternoon.
Question 150. It is becoming.............. more difficult to find designers who are familiar with this software.
Question 151. Of the six employees in ______ department he is the hardest working one.
Question 152. The Technical Department is currently formulating written guidelines ------- the use of our micro-publishing facilities.
Question 153. Actually, the Department of Transportation is responsible .............. approving roadwork permits in the county.
Question 154. ..............leaving school, she has worked in a variety of positions but has not yet found one which suits her talents or interests.
Question 155. Analysts regarded the ..............between the construction giants a win-win situation for both companies.
Question 156. For such a large building project, you'll need to take out a massive loan to raise the necessary..............
Question 157. An investment ________ gradually increases in value over the years can be more profitable than more short-term alternatives.
Question 158. Maurice Robertson, _________an executive at a small company, became the CEO of Bradshaw Industries four months ago.
Question 159. An independent investigator ------- a report on the company's financial operations which, for some unknown reason,was never released.
Question 160. Windpower Co. is faced with financial hardship, so in order to overcome this crisis, ______ ﬁnancial support is needed.
Question 161. Thanks to the advances in technology the state-of-the-art device is made _______ out of plastic.
Question 162. Mr. Fukui _______ washes his hands with anti-bacterial detergent right after coming home.
Question 163. Please read the -- ----- passages carefully, and then answer the multiple choice questions below within the time allotted.
Question 164. The sudden rainstorm arrived______, leaving a trail of damage which many predict will take some time to repair.
Question 165. Please accept our _______ apology for the mistakes that we made on the last project.
Question 166. BMC publishing company will be checking the article _______ mistakes and edit it before printing.
Question 167. Please place your luggage in the overhead locker, and ensure that the locker is closed --------.
Question 168. We would like to inform our employees that any complaints should be ------- to their union representative at first.
Question 169. The new tax cuts are designed ------ low-income earners and those with young families.
Question 170. The budget to be released later this week will ------- reduce spending on employee facilities such as the sports center.
Question 171. Following media criticism ------- the Defense Secretary's performance, the President today spoke in his defense at a special press conference.
Question 172. ------- good evaluations from their immediate bosses should be the main objective of those who wish to be promoted this year.
